segment.source: Configure Intune certificate profiles
segment.target: Configure Intune certificate profiles

segment.source: Configure Intune certificate profiles
segment.target: Configure Intune certificate profiles

segment.source: After your infrastructure and certificates are configured as described in Configure certificate infrastructure, you can configure certificate profiles:
segment.target: After your infrastructure and certificates are configured as described in Configure certificate infrastructure, you can configure certificate profiles:

segment.source: Task 1 - Export the Trusted Root CA certificate
segment.target: Task 1 - Export the Trusted Root CA certificate

segment.source: Task 2 - Create Trusted CA certificate profiles
segment.target: Task 2 - Create Trusted CA certificate profiles

segment.source: Task 3 - Either:
segment.target: Task 3 - Either:

segment.source: Create SCEP certificate profiles
segment.target: Create SCEP certificate profiles

segment.source: Create .PFX certificate profiles
segment.target: Create .PFX certificate profiles

segment.source: Task 1 - Export the Trusted Root certificate
segment.target: Task 1 - Export the Trusted Root certificate

segment.source: Export the Trusted Root CA certificate as a .cer file from the issuing CA, or any device that trusts your issuing CA.
segment.target: Export the Trusted Root CA certificate as a .cer file from the issuing CA, or any device that trusts your issuing CA.

segment.source: You do not export the private key.
segment.target: You do not export the private key.

segment.source: You will import this certificate when you configure a Trusted certificate profile.
segment.target: You will import this certificate when you configure a Trusted certificate profile.

segment.source: Task 2 - Create Trusted certificate profiles
segment.target: Task 2 - Create Trusted certificate profiles

segment.source: You must create a Trusted certificate profile before you can create a SCEP or .PFX certificate profile.
segment.target: You must create a Trusted certificate profile before you can create a SCEP or .PFX certificate profile.

segment.source: You need a Trusted certificate profile and a SCEP or.PFS profile for each mobile device platform.
segment.target: You need a Trusted certificate profile and a SCEP or.PFS profile for each mobile device platform.

segment.source: To create a trusted certificate profile
segment.target: To create a trusted certificate profile

segment.source: Open the Intune administration console, and click Policy > Add Policy.
segment.target: Open the Intune administration console, and click Policy > Add Policy.

segment.source: Configure one of the following policy types:
segment.target: Configure one of the following policy types:

segment.source: Android > Trusted Certificate Profile (Android 4 and later)
segment.target: Android > Trusted Certificate Profile (Android 4 and later)

segment.source: iOS > Trusted Certificate Profile (iOS 7.1 and later)
segment.target: iOS > Trusted Certificate Profile (iOS 7.1 and later)

segment.source: Mac OS X > Trusted Certificate Profile (Mac OS X 10.9 and later)
segment.target: Mac OS X > Trusted Certificate Profile (Mac OS X 10.9 and later)

segment.source: Windows > Trusted Certificate Profile (Windows 8.1 and later)
segment.target: Windows > Trusted Certificate Profile (Windows 8.1 and later)

segment.source: Windows > Trusted Certificate Profile (Windows Phone 8.1 and later)
segment.target: Windows > Trusted Certificate Profile (Windows Phone 8.1 and later)

segment.source: Learn more: Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: Learn more: Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Provide the requested information to configure the trusted certificate profile settings for Android, iOS, Mac OS X, Windows 8.1, or Windows Phone 8.1.
segment.target: Provide the requested information to configure the trusted certificate profile settings for Android, iOS, Mac OS X, Windows 8.1, or Windows Phone 8.1.

segment.source: In the Certificate file setting, import the Trusted Root CA certificate (.cer) that you exported from your issuing CA.
segment.target: In the Certificate file setting, import the Trusted Root CA certificate (.cer) that you exported from your issuing CA.

segment.source: The Destination store setting applies only to devices running Windows 8.1 and later, and only if the device has more than one certificate store.
segment.target: The Destination store setting applies only to devices running Windows 8.1 and later, and only if the device has more than one certificate store.

segment.source: When you are finished, click Save Policy.
segment.target: When you are finished, click Save Policy.

segment.source: The new policy displays in the Policy workspace, and can now be deployed.
segment.target: The new policy displays in the Policy workspace, and can now be deployed.

segment.source: Task 3 – Create SCEP or .PFX certificate profiles
segment.target: Task 3 – Create SCEP or .PFX certificate profiles

segment.source: After you have created a Trusted CA certificate profile, create SCEP or .PFX certificate profiles for each platform you want to use.
segment.target: After you have created a Trusted CA certificate profile, create SCEP or .PFX certificate profiles for each platform you want to use.

segment.source: When you create a SCEP certificate profile, you must specify a Trusted certificate profile for that same platform.
segment.target: When you create a SCEP certificate profile, you must specify a Trusted certificate profile for that same platform.

segment.source: This links the two certificate profiles, although you must still deploy each profile separately.
segment.target: This links the two certificate profiles, although you must still deploy each profile separately.

segment.source: To create a SCEP certificate profile
segment.target: To create a SCEP certificate profile

segment.source: Open the Intune administration console, click Policy > Add Policy.
segment.target: Open the Intune administration console, click Policy > Add Policy.

segment.source: Configure one of the following policy types:
segment.target: Configure one of the following policy types:

segment.source: Android > SCEP Certificate Profile (Android 4 and later)
segment.target: Android > SCEP Certificate Profile (Android 4 and later)

segment.source: iOS > SCEP Certificate Profile (iOS 7.1 and later)
segment.target: iOS > SCEP Certificate Profile (iOS 7.1 and later)

segment.source: Mac OS X > SCEP Certificate Profile (Mac OS X 10.9 and later)
segment.target: Mac OS X > SCEP Certificate Profile (Mac OS X 10.9 and later)

segment.source: Windows > SCEP Certificate Profile (Windows 8.1 and later)
segment.target: Windows > SCEP Certificate Profile (Windows 8.1 and later)

segment.source: Windows > SCEP Certificate Profile (Windows Phone 8.1 and later)
segment.target: Windows > SCEP Certificate Profile (Windows Phone 8.1 and later)

segment.source: Learn more: Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: Learn more: Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Follow the instructions on the profile configuration page to configure the SCEP certificate profile settings.
segment.target: Follow the instructions on the profile configuration page to configure the SCEP certificate profile settings.

segment.source: When you are finished, click Save Policy.
segment.target: When you are finished, click Save Policy.

segment.source: The new policy displays in the Policy workspace, and can now be deployed.
segment.target: The new policy displays in the Policy workspace, and can now be deployed.

segment.source: To create a .PFX certificate profile
segment.target: To create a .PFX certificate profile

segment.source: Open the Intune administration console, click Policy > Add Policy.
segment.target: Open the Intune administration console, click Policy > Add Policy.

segment.source: Configure one of the following policy types:
segment.target: Configure one of the following policy types:

segment.source: Android >.PFX Certificate Profile (Android 4 and later)
segment.target: Android >.PFX Certificate Profile (Android 4 and later)

segment.source: Windows > PKCS #12 (.PFX) Certificate Profile (Windows 10 and later)
segment.target: Windows > PKCS #12 (.PFX) Certificate Profile (Windows 10 and later)

segment.source: Windows > PKCS #12 (.PFX) Certificate Profile (Windows Phone 10 and later)
segment.target: Windows > PKCS #12 (.PFX) Certificate Profile (Windows Phone 10 and later)

segment.source: iOS > PKCS #12 (.PFX) Certificate Profile (iOS 7.1 and later)
segment.target: iOS > PKCS #12 (.PFX) Certificate Profile (iOS 7.1 and later)

segment.source: Learn more: Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: Learn more: Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Provide the information requested on the policy form.
segment.target: Provide the information requested on the policy form.

segment.source: When you are finished, click Save Policy.
segment.target: When you are finished, click Save Policy.

segment.source: The new policy displays in the Policy workspace, and can now be deployed.
segment.target: The new policy displays in the Policy workspace, and can now be deployed.

segment.source: Deploy certificate profiles
segment.target: Deploy certificate profiles

segment.source: When you deploy certificate profiles, the certificate file from the Trusted CA certificate profile is installed on devices, and the SCEP or .PFX certificate profile is used by the device to create a certificate request by the device.
segment.target: When you deploy certificate profiles, the certificate file from the Trusted CA certificate profile is installed on devices, and the SCEP or .PFX certificate profile is used by the device to create a certificate request by the device.

segment.source: Certificate profiles install only on applicable devices based on the platform you use when creating the profile.
segment.target: Certificate profiles install only on applicable devices based on the platform you use when creating the profile.

segment.source: You can deploy certificate profiles to user collections or device collections.
segment.target: You can deploy certificate profiles to user collections or device collections.

segment.source: To allow certificates to be published to devices quickly after the device enrolls, deploy the certificate profile to a user group (not a device group).
segment.target: To allow certificates to be published to devices quickly after the device enrolls, deploy the certificate profile to a user group (not a device group).

segment.source: If you deploy to a device group, a full device registration must take place before the device receives policy.
segment.target: If you deploy to a device group, a full device registration must take place before the device receives policy.

segment.source: Although each profile is deployed separately, both the Trusted Root and the SCEP/.PFX profile must be deployed or else the SCEP/.PFX certificate policy will fail.
segment.target: Although each profile is deployed separately, both the Trusted Root and the SCEP/.PFX profile must be deployed or else the SCEP/.PFX certificate policy will fail.

segment.source: You deploy certificate profiles the same way you deploy other policy for .
segment.target: You deploy certificate profiles the same way you deploy other policy for .

segment.source: For information about how to deploy and manage policies, see Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For information about how to deploy and manage policies, see Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Next steps
segment.target: Next steps

segment.source: You can now use certificates to help secure email, Wi-Fi, and VPN profiles:
segment.target: You can now use certificates to help secure email, Wi-Fi, and VPN profiles:

segment.source: Configure access to corporate email using email profiles
segment.target: Configure access to corporate email using email profiles

segment.source: Help users connect to company networks using Wi-Fi profiles
segment.target: Help users connect to company networks using Wi-Fi profiles

segment.source: Help users connect to their work using VPN profiles
segment.target: Help users connect to their work using VPN profiles
